title: Drawing, Mount of Olives, Bethany, Siloam, and Jerusalem, Palestine [Bethany and Silwan, East Jerusalem, and Jerusalem, Israel], February 7and 10, 1868
title_raw: Mount of Olives, Bethany, Siloam, and Jerusalem, Palestine [Bethany and Silwan, East Jerusalem, and Jerusalem, Israel]
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper
inscribed:
Recto:  Inscribed in graphite, at lower left:  Jerusalem - Mt. of Olives; at lower right:  Bethany/Siloam; throughout:  2/green/road/ledges/rock/Terrace/E [with directional signal?].
Verso:  Inscribed in graphite, at lower right:  Tower at Ramleh/Stone white/Color of stone gold Brown/greyed and olived by time/Feb 7/68.
description:
Recto:  Horizontal oblique view down into valley, a continuation of 1917-4-184 verso.
Verso: Horizontal view of the tower at Ramleh.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Mount of Olives, Bethany, Siloam, and Jerusalem, Palestine [Bethany and Silwan, East Jerusalem, and Jerusalem, Israel], February 7and 10, 1868. Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper. 
Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-454
